title: Adding functionality for distributed Openwhisk deployments
body:
We are proposing adding support for distributed Openwhisk deployments. The following playbooks have the ability to provision VMs and deploy openwhisk on top of them.

provision_env_dist.yml
boot_instances_dist.yml
configure_env_dist.yml
build_images_dist.yml

In a nutshell, provision_env_dist.yml iterates through an array of instances (defined like so https://github.com/animeshsingh/openwhisk/blob/master/ansible/environments/distributed/group_vars/all#L63:L90). 

The configuration information for each instance is passed to the boot_instances_dist.yml playbook, which uses the os_server module to make provisioning requests directly against the IaaS. 

Once the VMs have been provisioned, the build.yml playbook creates and pushes the following images to the private docker registry https://github.com/animeshsingh/openwhisk/blob/master/ansible/environments/distributed/group_vars/all#L32:L48 

Once the images have been built and pushed, the configure_env_dist.yml playbook calls the couchdb, initdb, wipe, openwhisk, and postdeploy playbooks. If these are successful, a sample "hello" action is invoked to ensure the deployment worked.

We also pulled in the docker, registry, prereq_build, and whiskhost roles/playbooks from the bluewhisk project. There were a few minimal changes we made to each role. We have added conditional statements so that these changes are only to be used if the "deployment" variable in the ansible/group_vars/all file is updated from "blue" to "open"
- docker: Adjusted the "add user to docker group" task to add the ansible_ssh_user instead of hard coded id
  https://github.com/animeshsingh/openwhisk/blob/master/ansible/roles/docker/tasks/deploy.yml#L32
- registry: Adjusted the gencert playbook to place the generated ssl key/cert into the "ansible/files" directory instead of the /tmp directory. Before this change, the registry role would fail because it was looking for the certs in the "ansible/files" directory
  https://github.com/animeshsingh/openwhisk/blob/master/ansible/roles/registry/tasks/gencert.yml#L8:L10

title: Catch expections in ActivationFeed due to Kafka poll/commit failure and retry (Supersedes #990)
body:
Modify activation feed so that we grab next batch of messages and commit offsets immediately, essentially marking the activation has having satisfied "at most once" semantics (this is the point at which the activation is considered started); if the commit fails, then messages peeked are peeked again on the next poll.

While the commit is synchronous and will block until it completes, at steady state with enough buffering (i.e., maxPipelineDepth > maxPeek), the latency of the commit should be masked.

Add kafka test where we intentionally fail the commit and then confirm recovery.

Supersedes #990.
PPG 960 approved.

title: WIP: another test PR
body:
envelope

OpenWhisk actions are expected to declare a global "main" function
However, this does not work well if you want to develop multiple actions in a single Xcode target, as you cannot re-declare a global main function.
This solution suggests that users working in Xcode may optionally declare their main function inside a struct, in order to solve the namespacing issue at compliation time.
Just before the .swift code is run, if a struct declaration is found, peel away the struct to reveal the delicious main function contained inside.

title: Use akka-http for requests from the invoker to the containers
body:
Stepping stone towards streaming `exec` data from the database to the containers. This commit replicates existing behavior but replaces the blocking Apache HTTP client by akka-http.

This commit also introduces a new helper object, `NewHttpUtils` to make non-pooled, possibly retrying, HTTP requests using the `akka-http` data model. (Candidates for a better object name are welcome.)

FYI @rabbah @markusthoemmes

title: Make the catalog able to install from openwhisk-catalog repos
body:
Currently, the catalog is installed by default together with
openwhisk. This patch adds a parameter named catalog_source to
determine whether to install the catalog from openwhisk-catalog.

If it is "catalog-repos", install the catalog from all the available
catalog repos. If it is set to any value except "catalog-repos",
openwhisk will not install catalog from the openwhisk-catalog.
The command to install the catalog from openwhisk-catalog is:
"ansible-playbook -i environments/local postdeploy.yml -e catalog_source=catalog-repos".

The script installCatalog.sh in the catalog needs to be able to
parse catalog_auth_key, api_host and catalog_namespace as the arguments.

Closes-Bug: #719

title: Kafka consumer throttling in invoker
body:
Introduced an actor polls the message bus for new messages and dispatches them to the given
handler. The actor tracks the number of messages dispatched and will not dispatch new
messages until some number of them are acknowledged.

This is used by the invoker to pull messages from the message bus and apply back pressure
when the invoker does not have resources to complete processing messages (i.e., no containers
are available to run new actions).

When the invoker releases resources (by reclaiming containers) it will send a message
to this actor which will then attempt to fill the pipeline with new messages.

The actor tries to fill the pipeline with additional messages while the number
of outstanding requests is below the pipeline fill threshold.

IPG 288 approved. Closes #143.

title: Optimize completion path of active ack
body: Currently we fetch the logs before making an activation record which we send back.  Instead, since active ack does not carry logs anyway, we can send back a log-less activation record first.  Then get the logs, make a more complete activation record, and records this in the database.  PPG811 passed

repo.description: Apache OpenWhisk is an open source serverless cloud platform

title: Jenkins/Travis tools script, for monitoring and analyzing jobs from CI.
body:
Example use to monitor a travis build, job number N:

> citool monitor N

To monitor same job until completion:

> citool monitor -p N

To save job output to a file:

> citool -o monitor N

Example use to monitor a jenkins build B with job number N:

> citool -u https://jenkins.host:port -b B monitor N

see readme in commit for more examples.

title: Make the installation of catalog optional
body:
As a non-core component, catalog installation should be optional.
Currently, the catalog is installed by default together with
openwhisk. This patch adds a parameter named catalog_source to
determine where and whether to install the catalog.

If catalog_source is "openwhisk": install the catalog from openwhisk.
If it is "openwhisk-catalog", install the catalog from openwhisk-catalog.
If it is set to "none", do not install catalog by default.

Closes-Bug: #719
